body_html: maskedSelect test is fixed in a8e816f. As for the ReLU test, it appears to happen around once in 15000 tests and it's due to the non-differentiability of ReLU at 0 (it happens when randn returns a number in interval of [-1e-6, 1e-6]). If we want to make the tests failproof we would need to mark the non-differentiable points of each function/module and make sure no input is too close to them.

body: `maskedSelect` test is fixed in a8e816f. As for the ReLU test, it appears to happen around once in 15000 tests and it's due to the non-differentiability of ReLU at 0 (it happens when randn returns a number in interval of [-1e-6, 1e-6]). If we want to make the tests failproof we would need to mark the non-differentiable points of each function/module and make sure no input is too close to them.
